message.content: This question requires some basic knowledge about the factors that determine skin color. Jamaican natives have a dark skin tone due to solar radiation. The melanin pigment in their skin provides protection against harmful UV radiation from the sun. Option (A) is incorrect because the dark skin tone is not due to a lack of nutrients. Option (B) is not accurate because camouflage is not the reason for their dark skin tone. Option (D) is also incorrect because while diet can affect overall health, it does not directly determine skin color.

This question requires some basic knowledge about the factors that influence skin color. Jamaican natives have a dark skin tone due to solar radiation. The high levels of solar radiation in Jamaica require the body to produce more melanin, which gives the skin its dark color and helps protect it from the harmful effects of the sun. Option (A) is incorrect because the dark skin tone is not due to a lack of nutrients. Option (B), camouflage, is not related to skin color. Option (D), their diet, does not directly influence skin color.
